intro: Montanoa pittieri, commonly known as the Mexican velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety texture. Montanoa pittieri produces yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat.
